definition[0]: to make a very high loud sound, especially because you are afraid, angry, excited, or in pain
example[0]: They were dragged from their homes, shrieking and weeping.
example[2]: A group of students were shrieking with laughter.
definition[1]: to say something in a high loud voice because you are excited, afraid, or angry
example[4]: ‘I’ll kill you!’ Anne shrieked at him.
definition[2]: a loud high sound made because you are frightened, excited, angry etc
example[5]: Ella let out a piercing shriek.
example[7]: With a shriek of delight, Jean hugged Maggie.
